content.question: Which age-structure diagram best depicts the ages in a population that is in stage 3 of the demographic transition?

choices.label: The age structure diagram shows males, percent, on the left of the horizontal axis, and females, percent, on the right of the horizontal axis. The vertical axis is labeled “Age,” and the numbers 15, 40, and 65 are indicated at equal intervals along the axis. The diagram shows the highest percentages of individuals in the youngest age groups, with the percentage decreasing steeply at first and then more gradually above the age of 15.

The age structure diagram shows males, percent, on the left of the horizontal axis, and females, percent, on the right of the horizontal axis. The vertical axis is labeled “Age,” and the numbers 15, 40, and 65 are indicated at equal intervals along the axis. The diagram shows the highest percentages of individuals in the youngest age groups, with the percentage decreasing very gradually at first, and then more and more steeply above the age of 40. The percentage of individuals in the age groups is fairly constant until after age 40.

The age structure diagram shows males, percent, on the left of the horizontal axis, and females, percent, on the right of the horizontal axis. The vertical axis is labeled “Age,” and the numbers 15, 40, and 65 are indicated at equal intervals along the axis. The diagram shows the highest percentages of individuals in the youngest age groups, with the percentage decreasing steadily in a straight line as age increases.

The age structure diagram shows males, percent, on the left of the horizontal axis, and females, percent, on the right of the horizontal axis. The vertical axis is labeled “Age,” and the numbers 15, 40, and 65 are indicated at equal intervals along the axis. The diagram shows moderate percentages of individuals in the youngest age groups, with the percentage gradually increasing, reaching its highest percentage approximately halfway between ages 15 and 40. The percentage then decreases gradually at first, and then more and more steeply as age increases above 40.

content.answer: The age structure diagram shows males, percent, on the left of the horizontal axis, and females, percent, on the right of the horizontal axis. The vertical axis is labeled “Age,” and the numbers 15, 40, and 65 are indicated at equal intervals along the axis. The diagram shows the highest percentages of individuals in the youngest age groups, with the percentage decreasing very gradually at first, and then more and more steeply above the age of 40. The percentage of individuals in the age groups is fairly constant until after age 40.

skill.text: Skill 5.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
